column36: We do a great job at keeping cross-functional departments in the loop. Every department knows what the other is working on and it helps immensely for our operations and customer-facing roles as well.

column32: Collaborative, Innovative, Results-driven, Transparent, Fast-paced, Flexible
column36: All is working great, this is more of a suggestion. We can probably think of developing a work abroad policy which very standard in the industry and that way employees don't need to take time off to travel

Very happy with my relationship to my job overall, It is exciting to be part of a fast moving young company. The job is stressful and it can be overwhelming at times just how much work there is to do but I don't think those are inherently negative things. I think its important we work hard to preserve the cross functional collaborative spirit as all of the teams continue to grow. Leadership needs to be hyper-focused on making sure no un-kind people are allowed into the group and that no bullying is tolerated within it.

I think management has done a tremendous job growing the company from a scrappy start up to an established Saas company. Going through some bumps along the way, but I understand. I do think that certain mistakes can easily be avoided by being more transparent with direction. 

Management could do a better job of appreciating staff. Sometimes saying "good job" goes a long way.

- It will be nice to have some flexibility when it comes to coming to the office, for example, choosing which 3 days of the week you want to come, etc. 
- It will be nice to have a stipend for software to do our job better, as well as a stipend for office equipment, for example, if we need a monitor, etc. 
- It will be nice if we have the opportunity to participate in field-specific conferences that are explicitly related to our role, that has courses and learning opportunities for our team. 

Other than that, ALT is an amazing company to be part of. Yes, there are growing pains, but this is the nature of any startup.

column32: Collaborative, Innovative, Supportive, Results-driven, Inclusive, Transparent, Fast-paced, Flexible, Stressful, Bureaucratic
column36:
I tell people that I think I'm drinking too much of the AltPay Juice, as I am genuinely happy here. I think leadership is incredible, my direct peers are phenomenal, and cross-department peers are lovely to collaborate with when needed. 

I think as we continue to scale, culture will take a hit. There are a lot of opinions and big personalities, that are bound to clash. If we can figure out how to keep the feedback loop constructive and positive, I think we will catch a good groove.  

I think there is always room for improvement in core areas like communication, etc., but I am so happy here.

column32: Collaborative, Innovative, Supportive, Results-driven, Transparent, Flexible, Medium-paced. I think we can move faster
column36: Too many 1:1s and recurring meetings. Calls should be only held as needed, and substantially shortened. The goal is to move fast, but we have self-installed speed bumps

column36: When disruptive behavior isn’t addressed, it affects team morale and makes it harder to stay positive. The bigger challenge is the lack of visibility into how concerns are handled without transparency, it can feel like issues just linger. Having clearer HR processes and leadership follow through would help build more trust across the team.

column32: Collaborative, Innovative, Supportive, Results-driven, Inclusive, Fast-paced, Stressful
column36:
- We do a great job building a great team environment and tight knit relationships both inside teams and across departments. Let's find ways to continue that as we scale. 
- We do a great job supporting each other and working as a team to achieve our goals, again wether its internally among one team or cross departmental. Feels like even though we have our individual targets, we're still all focused on the big picture. 

- We should take another look at base salary with us moving to a hybrid work schedule vs. remote as additional expenses are now being incurred.
- Large expenses for conferences (things like flights) should not be fronted by reps and should be put on some sort of company card, especially as they can get quite costly. 

- Look into possibility of ramp programs for those looking to get promoted to new titles. Understand and agree with the value in showing your own initiative but there could be a more structured approach and clearer program that will allow employees to ramp to where they want to be and provide clearer guidelines of what it takes to get promoted.

column32: Collaborative, Innovative, Supportive, Results-driven, Inclusive, Transparent, Fast-paced, Flexible
column36: The company dynamic is really fun and collaborative. People come from differnt work backgrounds and we all come together to share experiences, what has worked and what has not. Everyone is a valuable contributor to the company success. I like that we make an effort to all (with the exception of Eng, who is in Brazil) to get together every few months to really build on the team culture of being able to work together. I think we do a really great job at hiring and making sure the people brought onboard would be good for the culture and provide positivity and energy to create something big together. I love that Baxter includes us on the Alt journey and wants us to be included on the growth and success. Maybe an improvement could be something like having an SE or some sort of liason locally that works with the Engineers and that also has access to the backend. This was be particularly useful if someone needs someone technical to join a quick call, for the folks in the West who work a bit later in the day and need something resolved, or anyone who needs immediate assistance. This could also help with faster response times to tickets. The Engineers are really great - not a complaint at all, more of a future suggestion as we continue to grow

Areas for Improvement:

Benefits Package – Offering a more comprehensive benefits package would make a big difference. Now that we are back in the office, a transportation allowance or meal allowance would help offset daily costs.

Retirement Planning – Introducing a pension plan (such as RRSP contributions) would provide long-term financial security and align with what many companies already offer.

Compensation Structure – Most companies provide annual salary increases, but this is currently missing. Implementing yearly salary reviews and increases would help employees feel valued and rewarded for their contributions.

Annual Bonus Program – A performance-based annual bonus structure (or another form of yearly compensation in addition to salary) would motivate employees and acknowledge achievements.

Career Growth & Development – Building a clear structure for career progression within the company would help employees envision their long-term future here.

Learning & Development – Establish programs for continuous learning, such as training, certifications, conferences, or workshops. This would help teams stay current with industry trends and sharpen their skills.

Investment in Tools & Resources – Continued investment in software, resources, and people is essential to support teams in performing their roles efficiently and effectively.

Company Outings/Activities – Whenever possible, team outings or special activities should take place during business hours to respect personal time and work-life balance.

Work-from-Office Policy – Reconsider the Toronto office requirement. Limiting in-office days to a maximum of two per week would create more fairness, especially since half of the company works remotely from Brazil, some work remotely from Vancouver, and many Ontario-based employees live two hours away from downtown Toronto.

One key area of improvement would be better communication on action plans for the direction of the business. We do share high level plans and goals of what we hope to see, but often times don't communicate when plans change causing confusion across each department. We should continue to have open office hours and leadership calls that allow us to bring forward questions, but also should be more proactive in sharing changes to business strategy and plans as this often times impacts employee moral and engagement.

column32: Collaborative, Innovative, Supportive, Results-driven, Inclusive, Fast-paced
Collaborative, Innovative, Supportive, Results-driven, Inclusive, Transparent, Fast-paced, Flexible
Collaborative, Innovative, Supportive, Results-driven, Inclusive, Transparent, Fast-paced, Flexible
column36:
- RRSP contribution: It would be great to have a plan in place for employer RRSP contributions to help support long-term financial wellness.
- Official remote work policy: One of the benefits of joining AP was the flexibility of being fully remote. Having an official policy in place would help everyone understand expectations while maintaining the ability to travel and work from different locations.
- Small product improvements: While we’ve made huge strides in developing exciting new features, some of the basics can be overlooked. Prioritizing smaller, high-impact improvements would go a long way. For example, adding the ability to search by invoice number within transactions or improving overall search functionality.
- Career growth: Providing clear career paths, including opportunities to transition into other departments, would help employees see a future with the company and plan their growth.
- Bonus structures: Establishing transparent bonus structures would be a great way to reward performance and motivate the team.
Company meet-ups: When we’re all together, it would be valuable to have more structured offsites with intentional planning and activities to make the most of our time in person. Most of the time we spend it doing presentations, and I think people would enjoy using that time to actually hang out and get to know each other.
- Learning & development opportunities: Support for professional growth through training programs, certifications, and attendance at role-specific conferences would help the team stay current and continue building expertise in their areas.

I enjoy the grind and grit of everyone collaborating together. It feels like internally promoting staff is no longer a priority and I feel like there is no transparency in communication of career growth/path.

I think we should focus more on culture. Having someone in the company dedicated to career development, culture, performance reviews, and benefits would really help strengthen people’s growth, behavior, and engagement.
